H0.text: Heat is produced when a guitar string is strummed to produce sound.

H1.text: Electricity is produced by a guitar string when it is strummed.

H2.text: Vibrations are what a guitar string makes when it is strummed to produce sound.

H3.text: Light is what a guitar string produces when it is strummed to produce sound.

A4.text: In musical instrument classification, string instruments, or chordophones, are musical instruments that produce sound from vibrating strings when a performer strums, plucks, strikes or sounds the strings in varying manners.

A5.text: The vibrations are transmitted to the body of the instrument, which often incorporates some sort of hollow or enclosed area.
